name: Gelada Baboon
description: The Gelada Baboon is a primate known for its distinctive red chest patch and complex social structure.
spread_note: Found in the highlands of Ethiopia.
food_note: Spends much of its time grazing, unique among primates.
reproduction: Gestation about 6 months, one infant born per female.
attractions: Fascinating in zoos due to their social behaviors and unique appearance.
projects_note: Not endangered, but habitat degradation is a concern.
breeding: Bred in captivity to study their behavior and genetics.
